Condemned to Death

A grim Semyonovsky Square, prisoners await execution.  
The air is thick with dread.  
Dostoevsky: “Is this the end for us?”  

Grigoryev trembles, eyes wide with fear.  
Grigoryev: “I can't bear this—please, no!”  

Suddenly, a drumbeat echoes.  
Soldier: “You are spared! Back to the scaffold!”  

Dostoevsky gasps, hope igniting.  
Dostoevsky: “We live! We live!”  

---  

A dark prison cell, shadows loom.  
Dostoevsky reflects on his fate.  
Dostoevsky: “Suffering shapes the soul, doesn’t it?”  

Grigoryev, now lost, stares blankly.  
Grigoryev: “What have we become?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Dostoevsky's near-execution and subsequent imprisonment profoundly influenced his writing and views on suffering and cruelty.
